section_title: Meniscal Repair or Meniscectomy - Acute Traumatic (Evidence: pg no: 9, L416-L417)
names: Acute traumatic meniscal tear (Evidence: pg no: 9, L417)
description: Meniscal repair or meniscectomy for acute traumatic meniscal tear with sudden onset of joint-line pain (Evidence: pg no: 9, L418-L419)
scope: Treatment of acute meniscal tears (Evidence: pg no: 9, L416-L440)

documentation: Knee injury within last 3 months with new onset knee pain (Evidence: pg no: 9, L420)
Moderate to severe pain associated with functional limitation (Evidence: pg no: 9, L421-L422)
Symptoms of catching, locking, or instability (Evidence: pg no: 9, L423)
Physical exam findings of at least TWO: Joint swelling or effusion, Positive McMurray or Apley test, Joint line tenderness, or Reduced range of motion (Evidence: pg no: 9, L424-L429)
Imaging confirms features of an acute meniscal tear (Evidence: pg no: 9, L432-L433)

exclusions: For x-rays with Kellgren-Lawrence grade 3 or 4 changes and knee pain preceding recent injury (Evidence: pg no: 10, L439-L440)

codes.description: Arthroscopy, knee, surgical; with meniscectomy (medial AND lateral, including any meniscal shaving) including debridement/shaving of articular cartilage (chondroplasty), same or separate compartment(s), when performed (Evidence: pg no: 16, L709-L710)

Arthroscopy, knee, surgical; with meniscectomy (medial OR lateral, including any meniscal shaving) including debridement/shaving of articular cartilage (chondroplasty), same or separate compartment(s), when performed (Evidence: pg no: 16, L711-L712)
Arthroscopy, knee, surgical; with meniscus repair (medial OR lateral) (Evidence: pg no: 16, L713)
Arthroscopy, knee, surgical; with meniscus repair (medial AND lateral) (Evidence: pg no: 16, L714)

notes: Partial meniscectomy considered medically necessary for symptomatic tears not amenable to repair. Meniscal repair considered medically necessary for symptomatic reducible tears that are peripheral (Evidence: pg no: 9, L434-L437)
